alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills and the Diablo Range; East Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 8:17AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Alameda, central Contra Costa and northwestern Santa Clara Counties through 915 AM PST... At 816 AM PST, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near San Ramon, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Dangerous lightning. Pea size hail. Locally heavy rain. Potential for erratic outflow wind gusts to 30 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. People should seek shelter from lightning. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Concord, Antioch, Livermore, Mountain View, San Ramon, Pleasanton, Union City, Palo Alto, Walnut Creek, Pittsburg, Cupertino, Dublin, Newark, Danville, Oakley, Pleasant Hill and Menlo Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
